the state of balance which is thought to exist in the earth's lithosphere (= solid outer layer) in relation to its mantle (= the part that surrounds the central core): He later devoted his research to the relationship of isostasy to mountain and deep basin formation. The term isostasy was introduced by the American geologist Dutton in 1889.
